intro: Achillea erba-rotta subsp. ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous yarrow, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny environments such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is known for its aromatic foliage and is often used in traditional herbal medicine. Its common name reflects the variability in its morphological features, which can make it challenging to distinguish from related species.
